trans-unit.source: Obtains information about the display devices in a system

seg-source.mrk: Obtains information about the display devices in a system

target.mrk: Obtains information about the display devices in a system

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Device name. If blank, the function returns information for the display adapters on the machine based on $iDevNum.

seg-source.mrk: If blank, the function returns information for the display adapters on the machine based on $iDevNum.

target.mrk: If blank, the function returns information for the display adapters on the machine based on $iDevNum.

trans-unit.source: 0-based index value that specifies the display device of interest

seg-source.mrk: 0-based index value that specifies the display device of interest

target.mrk: 0-based index value that specifies the display device of interest

trans-unit.source: Return Value
an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: $aDevice[0] - True
$aDevice[1] - Either the adapter device or the monitor device

seg-source.mrk: $aDevice[1] - Either the adapter device or the monitor device

target.mrk: $aDevice[1] - Either the adapter device or the monitor device

trans-unit.source: $aDevice[2] - Either a description of the adapter or the monitor

seg-source.mrk: $aDevice[2] - Either a description of the adapter or the monitor

target.mrk: $aDevice[2] - Either a description of the adapter or the monitor

trans-unit.source: $aDevice[3] - Device state flags:
1 - The device is part of the desktop

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The device is part of the desktop

target.mrk: 1 - The device is part of the desktop

trans-unit.source: 2 - The primary desktop is on the device

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The primary desktop is on the device

target.mrk: 2 - The primary desktop is on the device

trans-unit.source: 4 - Represents a pseudo device used to mirror application drawing for remoting

seg-source.mrk: 4 - Represents a pseudo device used to mirror application drawing for remoting

target.mrk: 4 - Represents a pseudo device used to mirror application drawing for remoting

trans-unit.source: 8 - The device is VGA compatible
16 - The device is removable; it cannot be the primary display

seg-source.mrk: 16 - The device is removable; it cannot be the primary display

target.mrk: 16 - The device is removable; it cannot be the primary display

trans-unit.source: 32 - The device has more display modes than its output devices support

seg-source.mrk: 32 - The device has more display modes than its output devices support

target.mrk: 32 - The device has more display modes than its output devices support

trans-unit.source: $aDevice[4] - reserved
sets the @error flag to non-zero.
See Also
Search EnumDisplayDevices in MSDN Library.

target.mrk: - The device is removable; it cannot be the primary display

trans-unit.source: - The device is VGA compatible
- Represents a pseudo device used to mirror application drawing for remoting

target.mrk: - Represents a pseudo device used to mirror application drawing for remoting

trans-unit.source: - The primary desktop is on the device

seg-source.mrk: - The primary desktop is on the device

target.mrk: - The primary desktop is on the device

trans-unit.source: - The device is part of the desktop
